titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Faculty & Adminstrators
titleInfo.subTitle: James Perry Cole oral history interview, 1977

name.description: Dean of students, director of student affairs (1932-41), and professor of mathematics at Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Interview discusses Cole's dealings with Louisiana State University as a student, faculty member, and administrator from 1905 to the 1940s. Includes his working relationships with Thomas D. Boyd, Troy H. Middleton, Lewis B. Sorley, Fred Charles Frey, Ione Burden, James Monroe Smith, Arden French, James F. Broussard, William Vann Parker, and Harold Stoke.; Topics include his work as Dean of Student Affairs, organization of the Louisiana State Guard, and organizing the first Boys' and Girls' State meets in 1940 and 1941 respectively.
